website_summaries.verdict: A solid option for lighter canoes and kayaks, but its wheel size makes it not the best option for use on sand.
pros: Easy to assemble and break down for storage
cons: Tires don't work well in sand
Strap isn't long enough or overly rugged
assembly isn't that hard to figure out, but you're still on your own

customer_reviews.title: A great kayak cart
customer_reviews.text: Freight shipping delivered our two new kayaks - but only to the bottom of a steep, gravel, 1/4 mile long driveway (our vehicle was out of commission). I used bungee cords instead of the strap that came with the cart to strap the kayak on - it was perfect. Easily got both up the steep gravel drive (one at a time) without having to stop and adjust once. Really saved my back having this handy cart. This will be great portaging through woods or down a sandy beach. Very happy with this sturdy cart.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley Kelley

customer_reviews.title: some advantages/disadvantages compared to air tires.
customer_reviews.text: I've used both air filled and these solid wheels now. the air filled are easier to pull your kayak with and handle rougher terrian.. but they don't last long. the solid is harder to pull but air 1 less thing to worry about. used this to walk 1/2 mile to lake for our tamdem and back and it was okay. attached to the kayak pretty easy.
customer_reviews.author: diydiy

customer_reviews.title: Simple, easy, works!
customer_reviews.text: Using this to get my two SUPs to the beach and lake. Like a lot of people said, the strap is a nice thing to send, but not really of much use. I got some bungee cords to tie stuff down. The one extra thing I added to this purchase, which I highly recommend if you're using it for a SUP is a suction cup handle. I got mine at Home Depot for about $6, but they have something similar on Amazon (, this is a major help since my hands are slippery and the SUP is slippery when I get out of the water and getting home is rough. The suction cup handle makes the whole process much easier.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal Surf

customer_reviews.title: I love the flat free tires.  Plenty sturdy for my 65 pound kayak.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased two similar carts in the past. Both had pneumatic tires and none of the tires would hold air. This one has solid wheels that work just fine. The wheels can be easily taken off and the whole cart will stow in my kayak's rear hatch My kayak weighs 65 pounds and this cart handles it easily. The nylon strap that came with the cart wasn't too useful. A couple of bungee cords actually works better.
customer_reviews.author: GrumpyShopper

customer_reviews.title: I've used it twice and it's worked great. Being a female there was no way I ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to cart my 12ft 60lb Pescador kayak down our stree to the dock. I've used it twice and it's worked great. Being a female there was no way I could carry this kayak down the street on my own. And this cart does the trick. It is a bit hard to pull over the thick grass getting the kayak out of our backyard but it's still managable. It rolls very well over the side walks and the rocky area around the dock. I use two straps that I already owned so not sure how well the strap provided works. But so far I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I got this today and assembled it is seconds. Attached my ten foot kayak to it and was able to simply walk my kayak to the shed to store it. I chose this version with the solid tires so I would not need to worry about inflation. This is a great product and well worth every penny as I am 65 yrs. old and can finally move my kayak with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Melody N.

customer_reviews.title: Weight distribution and placement.
customer_reviews.text: Love this item. It comes with a strap, to secure to the bottom of your kayak, but personally I use bungee cords. I’ve had to pull my kayak, up and down some pretty long and bumpy dirt roads, fully loaded with my camping gear. Would’ve never been able to get to some of the places, without these wheels. Just make sure your weight is evenly distributed, and you secure the wheels good, and you’re ready to roll! It did take me a couple of tries to get the hang of it. But, once I figure out weight distribution and placement, I’ve never had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for unpaved surface.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, well constructed, and compacts for easy storage. However it is only suitable to move a kayak on a flat, smooth surface like a paved parking lot or sidewalks. I’ve tried securing the kayak to the cart several different ways several times but any uneven turf, rock, or tree root will cause the kayak to slide out of position. It’s much less frustrating just to manually carry the kayak if you are not on a paved surface.
customer_reviews.author: SAIL SRQ

customer_reviews.title: The hold down straps are almost useless. The legs (
customer_reviews.text: This product leaves a lot to be desired. The hold down straps are almost useless. The legs (?) that are supposed to keep the dolly from sliding forward loading and unloading your yack just fold up with the slightest amount force. I purchased this for my 12ft. Eagle Talon SOT. I will make some modifications and hopefully get it to work if not I will trash it. Oh and the tires do smell two days out side cured that problem wish it was the only one I had with the product. The tires are pretty decent.
customer_reviews.author: headhunter

customer_reviews.title: Not right for my kayak....
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure it boils down to hull shape when getting the right cart. I bought this because it is fairly cheap but it does not work for my old town topwater at all. Strap that comes with it is trash. Wheels are wobbly. I put my kayak on and it just dumped over before I could make it 5 feet. If your kayak has a "double u" shaped hull like mine, do not buy this. I returned mine promptly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This little cart is amazing. It allows me to transport the whole families ...
customer_reviews.text: This little cart is amazing. It allows me to transport the whole families kayaks, and then I fold it up and strap it to the back of my kayak while in the water. I have had up to five kayaks (2 adult and 2 or 3 short kid kayaks) on it at once. This takes some work to get them centered and balanced, but it will hold a significant load.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great on concrete or compacted dirt, not sand
customer_reviews.text: Bought several of these...4 stars because it is light weight and folds flat, wheels easily removed by cotter pin. Fits neatly into kayak cargo space. Cons: Strap is a cheap one piece loop with snap; buckle does not hold in place, as strap loosens up easily. Wheels don't roll well on sand and cart will stay behind as kayak slip off cart (unless you secure strap to a fixed handle or something similar). To mitigate the deficiencies, I cut the single strap and buckled each of the straps to the frame of cart, seemed to help prevent Kayak from slipping off cart. If Cart came with this modification in the first place, I would have rated this 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jai

customer_reviews.title: but it doesn't really feel like it is cradled
customer_reviews.text: I think I am missing something on how to secure my kayak on this cart as it always feels clumsy...I can barely lift the kayak so I place the cart nearer to the end ....but it doesn't really feel like it is cradled. I use a bungee cord to secure it as the strap is unwieldy. It is perfect for loading into the back of my hatchback single handed , folds nicely, and travels well on the short walk I have to the water over fairly rugged dirt roads. Happy😎
customer_reviews.author: Patricia E. Bertocci

customer_reviews.title: I had a hard time keeping the boat on the cart
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time keeping the boat on the cart at first. It didn’t matter how tight I cinched down the strap, I’d dump the boat and all my gear two to three times on the forty yard walk to the creek. I wrapped some bicycle inner tube around the foam padding and replaced the strap with a ratchet strap and now I have a useable cart. And I like it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Cthorlu

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect, i just needed to secure the strap to ...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect, i just needed to secure the strap to the frame in a way they dont move around once that is done the wheels work perfect. I carry my kayay 10' from a parking lot about 300 feet away from water. Easy to move and secure the kayak. A great buy.
customer_reviews.author: howard

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty well thought out
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty well thought out. the tires are large enough to support my boat in sand, yet they're small enough that I can pack them on my boat on a trip. The nylon strap is of good quality, but the plastic buckle wasn't optimal. It didn't present an easy way to sustain a tight grip on the boat--a key requirement. We just put a bowline on one end of the strap and used the other end to make a tight tie. I'd recommend this to other paddlers.
customer_reviews.author: John Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I use this product to get my 13ft kayak to the beach or river. I am very pleased with it. I use it in both fresh and saltwater and there is hardly any sign of rust. It functions very well and easily gets Minecraft to whichever destination I am willing it to. Make sure you use the straps to secure your craft to the dolly. I will definitely purchase this again if I need to. Great price great product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never flat tires, nice product.
customer_reviews.text: I was leery about ordering this since I had read all the reviews, but I took the chance and am glad I did. The tires that were on mine are the never flat solid tires and the odor was almost non-existent, just a mild rubbery type smell, typical of anything with tires on it. I did follow some of the reviewers comments and get some ratchet straps instead of using the strap that came with it. It seems sturdy and just what I needed to save my back from carrying my kayak for long distances.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: Worked as expected on a 12' recreational kayak. I didn't notice any bad smell from the tires so maybe that has been fixed. The strap that came with it is pretty useless unless you are on perfectly flat ground. I used a ratchet strap wrapped through the dolly to really hold the yak. I was able to take it down a steep rough river bank to the water without it coming off the dolly. Be careful going sideways on steep terrain. If your hand is in the tow loop and the boat flips over as mine did you can get injured if you can't get your hand out in time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes a 12' kayak managable for one person without dragging.
customer_reviews.text: After reading previous reviews I didn't bother using the straps , but went straight to using a bungie cord. One person can easily position the kayak on it, bungie it down and haul your kayak comfortably by yourself with no dragging.
customer_reviews.author: luvxlk9

customer_reviews.title: Also note that these wheels are better served on solid ground vs
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality but very awkward to load and stabilize my 12' kayak. Also note that these wheels are better served on solid ground vs. beach sand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works for towing kayak with bicycle
customer_reviews.text: I tow my kayak with my bicycle using this. It works great, I use a ratchet strap instead of the one it came with. The wheels have held up fine thus far in bicycling through the neighborhood and on the highway.
customer_reviews.author: Ruston

customer_reviews.title: Efficient & well-made
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these, received them in a timely manner, and after simple assembly, they were put to use without an issue. They are well-made & convenient. I would recommend using basic bungee cords versus the included strap, but I love bungee cords!
customer_reviews.author: MCarrier

customer_reviews.title: Super fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Super fast shipping, I have a 12' kayak weights about 80lb I also load the kayak with chairs and beach towels and other things that we used wile at the beach and this cart handles all the load very well. The beach I use the cart has somewhat of hard sand haven't use it in soft sand yet but I believe it won't be a problem. I defenetly recommend the cart, I have the one with the solid wheels and theirs no smell at all and for the price I payed compared to other places I sure I wouldn't mind a little smell.
customer_reviews.author: dany

customer_reviews.title: Cart-orific !
customer_reviews.text: Once I find the perfect balance point for the kayak, easy to transport. I think I'd rather use my bungee cords to "secure" kayak to cart than included strap. I have a ways to travel (down the bumpy street), so maybe why I need more than strap. Good construction!
customer_reviews.author: JuliaBee

customer_reviews.title: Kayak Cart - Real Deal
customer_reviews.text: Have used the cart now for about 5 kayak trips. On some occasions, have strapped both of our 14.5 ft kayaks to walk them for a couple hundred feet from cabin to lake launch area. Cart handled it with no problem. I like the solid wheels - no inner tube to worry about maintaining air pressure. The cart folds up and can be carried with Wilderness kayak, the hatch opening on the Riot kayak was not large enough. Am pleased with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew W. Shank

customer_reviews.title: I love them
customer_reviews.text: I love these! Exactly what I needed for so long- now getting the kayaks to the local launch is a breeze, and I simply fold the cart and bungee cord it to my kayak and off I go. I didn't notice any overpowering odors from the wheels like some reviewers seemed to indicate, though to be fair, I also didn't sniff the tires and I keep these outside, so for me this wasn't an issue. for the price, this is perfect and I would definitely recommend them. I'm only mad at myself for not finding and ordering these sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Dianna

customer_reviews.title: Good little cart
customer_reviews.text: Mine is a little different then the picture don't know why but doesn't seem to effect the ability. Works pretty good so far. I use motor cycle handle bar straps to hold it down. My kayak is 14ft long about 100 lbs moves pretty easily now
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Light
customer_reviews.text: Works great for yak transport from truck to launch area. We have 12’ yaks... one rec, and one touring, and it works equally well with both. We found a bungee cord works better than the strap provided. Nice and compact when it’s folded. Have used it over grass, concrete, and mud, and tires have been great in all those conditions. A very good buy.
customer_reviews.author: N C G

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but no instructions
customer_reviews.text: I like it now that I figured out how to use it for my SUP board. The wheels have to go under the foam and the webbing goes through the bottom straps and around the board with a knot. I need a longer piece of webbing to make this tying method work though, something more like 15 feet. There were no instructions, so maybe there's a trick I'm not clued in on, but my way is secure enough and the wheels work great, if awkward to put on.
customer_reviews.author: Josh D

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice cart for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice cart for the price. once you figure out the best way to strap your boat on I thing will enjoy it. I have a p&h delphin 155 and I have no problems with it and it fits in my rear hatch.
customer_reviews.author: jhon

customer_reviews.title: The no air (solid tires) make this cart a FIVE STAR!
customer_reviews.text: For the cost, I rate this cart as a 5 star. The solid (no air) tires are a big plus. The cart is well made and works with kayaks or canoes. On rough terrain use the included strap(s). As an aside, never buy a cart with pump up tires. I wasted money on one (before I bought this cart). The Chinese made tubes (inside the tires) burst when you put in the recommended air pressure. Do yourself and back a favor, and buy this cart.
customer_reviews.author: Rockliff

customer_reviews.title: Great cart for heavy kayak.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. The strap is not very good so i just use 3 bungee cords and holds a100 pound yak in place on rocks, grass and sand. It arrived with a flat tire so i contacted the seller and he shipped a new tire for free, no questions asked. Others here exagerate about the smell; it goes away in a day outside. I have dip it in salt water a few times and no corrosion noted.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Even using my own straps, this cart falls off frequently when just hauling it between the shore and my car.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Big waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: This is very difficult to use. Sometimes I get it attached better than other times, but always, when pulling the kayak over rocks, it falls off of this device. It's been very frustrating and I have tried it over and over again. I wish I could return it but have had it too long. Not worth the money--no way!
customer_reviews.author: Gregg A. Vossler

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Would be cool if my canoe actually stayed on it...
customer_reviews.text: I can't seem to make my canoe stay on it, rendering it completely useless. I find myself stopping every 10 ft. to readjust. I regret buying this
customer_reviews.author: Sean Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Works good, but not sure that strap is doing anything
customer_reviews.text: First, there was no odor at all. There's like a 1/2 mile trail down to this beach I launch my kayak from. This worked well, all pavement. I'm not sure that strap is actually doing anything. It didn't seem to want to tighten very good. I think the kayak is mostly balancing on there, but had no problems pulling it up/down the trail.
customer_reviews.author: EJS

customer_reviews.title: You get what they advertised.
customer_reviews.text: You get what they advertised. So why not 5 stars?!? The weight this can carry guarantees that the higher ranges of weights will be for kayaks with non-conventional hulls. That being said the foam padding should cover more of the area that may come in contact with the hull
customer_reviews.author: rhaJ

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I am 68 years old and use this to cart my kayak from my camping spot to the lake. I didn't get the strapping as directed so I just figured out my own.
customer_reviews.author: Shonnie Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and set up....
customer_reviews.text: just got into kayaking so I purchased this cart to help me take my kayak to the water and back to the car since I go out by myself at times. Pleased with the quality and easy set up. Saves all my energy for being on the water.
customer_reviews.author: Diane M Routt

customer_reviews.title: Really a nice helper for my kayak
customer_reviews.text: After a learning curve and a good ratchet strap, this works really well. As a woman dealing with my own gear is important and this makes it easy to transport my rec kayak from car to launch and back.
customer_reviews.author: DonnaK

customer_reviews.title: Kayak cart
customer_reviews.text: Well made cart. Ni ptibkem with odor others mentioned. Easily assembled. Havent used yet.
customer_reviews.author: Sherrilee Lewis

customer_reviews.title: folds itself closed
customer_reviews.text: sorta works okay on my wife's skinny kayak doesn't work for beans on my wide dihedral hull. straps to tighten the yak down are useless and it rarely stays open and straight on the yak. gets a bonus star for the wheels goin over all terrains well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far, I'm impressed
customer_reviews.text: We looked at a few carriers in canoe & kayak shops that cost $100 and up. Honestly I see very little difference between those and this carrier. We ended up buying two. They seem well made and carry our 14 foot kayaks decently. I replaced the tie down straps with ratchet straps and they hold very securely. Seems to me like these will hold up for years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Beerfish

customer_reviews.title: Very Good but use different straps
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a very good item. The strap work leaves a little to be desired, as the boat often shifts and is then not aligned with the wheels. If there was a small bar that ran along the base of the boat and allowed for a strap... along with another stap by the wheels, it would increase stability. However, using a strong bungee cord or a better strap system (i found using both is best) helps. otherwise, it is great to be able to cart our kayaks from our home a few blocks to the river.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen P. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but straps are terrible
customer_reviews.text: My Kayak has too much of a V underneath so it has to sit on its side on the cart. Secondly, the straps that comes with this cart is crap. They don't hold tightly and when walking with the kayak, the cart ends up sliding off due to poor straps. I will keep it for now but recommend buying better straps
customer_reviews.author: P&A

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Terrible the straps broke on first use doesn't stay and foam padding shreadded dont buy waste of money not ment for canoe only kyack
customer_reviews.author: shady angel

customer_reviews.title: stores easily on my boat
customer_reviews.text: This carrier has made it possible for me to take my kayak out alone without fear of damaging it. It works well, stores easily on my boat. It took a couple of tries to find the best placement for it, and easiest way to secure the kayak to it as instructions were vague. But it was fairly easy to master. I would highly recommend it if you have a longer, awkward to carry boat.
customer_reviews.author: Nana Deb

customer_reviews.title: You'll need to buy "real" straps...
customer_reviews.text: Works well although the included straps are generally useless. I had some straps with an S hook at one end and a friction adjustable buckle at the other that I used in place of the included straps. Works great with that set up. We walk the kayaks maybe a quarter mile on pavement with no problem. We live in a neighborhood with a boat launch and this is a good solution. Otherwise we had to put them on our trailer and pull them to the boat ramp.
customer_reviews.author: ECinEI

customer_reviews.title: So far so good with this one
customer_reviews.text: So far so good with this one. I like the fact that it has to tubeless tires on it. I purchase one from a local place and pay twice as much and had nothing but problems with the tubes popping.
customer_reviews.author: todd stogdell

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Works ok. The strap the comes with it is useless. Doesn't hold tight at all.
customer_reviews.author: cdemarse

customer_reviews.title: It works great, and I am pleased as punch
customer_reviews.text: The kayak dolly arrived just in time to try out for the weekend. It works great, and I am pleased as punch. I'd buy from these folks again.
customer_reviews.author: PHD711

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Took some figuring on how to get the kayak to stay on but we have it figured out. Rolls right along. Saves me from having to help carry it!! Folds nice for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Scuba Su

customer_reviews.title: Much easier to move your kayak
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Mom. She had been dragging her kayak and was begging to wear down the end. This is much easier for her to use and better for keeping the kayak in good shape. Also it is very easy to unfold and set the boat on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice wheels!
customer_reviews.text: Saves my back! I live a couple hundred yards from the lake and it has proven itself every time.
customer_reviews.author: x-ray

customer_reviews.title: Great product, works great on my 16" Grumman canoe
customer_reviews.text: Great product, works great on my 16" Grumman canoe. I added two straps with metal hooks to tie the canoe down. I broke the plastic hook the first time I tried it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: adequate
customer_reviews.text: The item that I received does not seem to have the wheelbase of the one in the picture. Because of the narrow wheelbase it wants to fall over when you get it off balance, which occurs every time you hit a bump. Once you realize its limitations and are very carefull about where you are rolling, it is OK for the price point. I only need to pull it about 25 yards and would not recommend for longer trips unless the terrain is smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C.

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and works great !
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the price ! Works out really well with strong bungee cords. I use this on a Jackson Journey and it runs well over sand, rocks and curbs - just make sure it's well secured. I've had two other more expensive carts and this one works far better than they did. Don't hesitate to get one of these - makes transporting your kayak much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Vicari

customer_reviews.title: Tires are a thumbs down!!
customer_reviews.text: We were so excited to use this product with our kayak. We finally had time to use it today. The tires say the max fill is 30 psi. As soon as we filled to 20 psi the inner tube popped making them unusable. This occurred on BOTH tires. :-( Definitely not recommending this product for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: There should be a better strap system to hold the kayak onto the cart ...
customer_reviews.text: once you get the kayak on the cart, it works well. There should be a better strap system to hold the kayak onto the cart when pulling up hill.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Cassara

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my 13' canoe. I picked the solid tire version so I wouldn't have to worry about tire inflation. It is solid and folds easily. As others have noted, the strap is useless. I just use bungee. Wish there were loops to attach the bungee or whatever I use to secure the canoe.
customer_reviews.author: M. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Good kayak cart
customer_reviews.text: Handy cart which makes getting to the lake or river easier on me and the bottom of my kayak. I wish the wheels folded up to make it more compact but it's a solid product and easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a back saver when getting the canoe back and ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a back saver when getting the canoe back and forth between the water and the truck. We'll see how well the foam pads hold up. The ones on my push mowers made from the same material tend to disintegrate fairly quickly with exposure to the elements.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy cart.
customer_reviews.text: The cart came exactly as pictured. It was very easy to put the wheels on. However the weather here has been so cold and rainy that I have not had a chance to use it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Fitzgerald-Casey

customer_reviews.title: it'll work just fine.
customer_reviews.text: I thought I had measured my kayak correctly for this product, but when I tried to strap the boat to the cart, nothing seemed to work. I think if I make some tweaks, it'll work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Shoemaker

customer_reviews.title: Price is right and no flat tires a must
customer_reviews.text: For price this is a usable kayak cart. It all depends on your kayak how good it works. Not the carts fault because it a universal cart. I have 3 kayaks and it works best in my Ocean Kayak Malibu 2.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Trolley for kayaks.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this kayak trolley for my grandchildren’s kayaks. Perfect for getting them down to the beach. Moves smoothly on the sand.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Nice kayak carrier, but tire went flat
customer_reviews.text: The carrier arrived within just a few days. It is very easy to put the wheels on, and took just a few minutes to adjust the strap for my kayak. I used it several times, and am very pleased at how easy it is to roll the kayak. The carrier folds up easily. The only problem in had was that one of the tires went flat after about a week. The cheap tube had just split. I probably could have sent it back, except that I had already tossed all the packing materials. I ordered a tube for about $10, and now I'm back in business.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Dood

customer_reviews.title: For the price this is an excellent buy.
customer_reviews.text: I used my cart last week for the first few times. It worked very well, and I was able to get my yak from about 300 feet from cabin to lake. The removable wheels are a major plus for transporting (inside of my yak storage compartment. For the price this is an excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: John G

customer_reviews.title: Kayak carrier
customer_reviews.text: Makes porting a kayak a world of difference. Would rebuy.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas G. Holland

customer_reviews.title: Very narrow
customer_reviews.text: Sent it back. Kayak would fall over with very small bumps or turns.
customer_reviews.author: Dug Joons

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Perfect and easy to use for the money. We use it to get the boat too and from the water (100 yards). Does what we need it for.
customer_reviews.author: Just a Dude

customer_reviews.title: VERY NICE DESIGN,  BIG TIRES,  GREAT MOVER
customer_reviews.text: Nice construction, I purchased it to move a heavy Discovery Sport Canoe. The weight of the canoe, battery etc kept the canoe in place on top of dolly with no straps, great on level ground. Next trip I will need bungee cord to keep boat on top of dolly for incline. Strap did come with unit, but no applicable for my use. I feel a good value, Looks to be very adaptable for various applications.
customer_reviews.author: LAR

customer_reviews.title: I agree it's seriously stinky, but it works so great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cart. It makes it so easy to get my kayak where ever I need to take it. It works on sand and rocky (small) beaches. It's very easy to figure out and use. The one mistake I made was to put the strap where it put pressure on the two little straps that hold the stabilization bar out for when you're loading your kayak. They both broke, but I think that was my fault. It still works fine without them though. I'm 5'1" and my kayak is 11 feet and weighs 50#. This little cart is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Allred

customer_reviews.title: I think bungee cords will work better to secure rather than provided straps
customer_reviews.text: A little unstable. I think bungee cords will work better to secure rather than provided straps
customer_reviews.author: Sheree Garrison

customer_reviews.title: THIS INSTALLS ON MY KAYAK PERFECTLY BUT I WISH IT ...
customer_reviews.text: THIS INSTALLS ON MY KAYAK PERFECTLY BUT I WISH IT CAME WITH A WIDER WHEELBASE AS IT WILL TIP OVER ON UNEVEN GROUND...
customer_reviews.author: Huey P. Galatas

customer_reviews.title: TMS CART-CANOE/KAYAK-KY001
customer_reviews.text: its not deluxe by any means it is a less money and simple design .the strap is useless find your own way to attach kayak /conoe i use a ratchet style strap ,snug not too tight! yes there is a strong rubber tire smell, leave outside couple days and its gone i would buy this again if lost or stolen not if it failed
customer_reviews.author: john locke

customer_reviews.title: This worked out great, I had to tote my kayak a half ...
customer_reviews.text: This worked out great, I had to tote my kayak a half block down in long beach, I had everything loaded on my kayak along with my Dog and it was a blast, I used bungies to secure it as the straps that came with it were not that great. The tires do smell pretty bad but I left them outside the garage for a few days and the smell was reduced. They still smell but it is slowly going away. You cant beat the price, item was shipped really fast to.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad Wright Jr

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Product
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. I find the if you use ratchet tie down straps it will stay secured much better. When use the ratchet straps to secure, can pull behind the golf cart with little trouble. Just watch your speed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They work great for short trips
customer_reviews.text: All you need! I bought this instead of some more expensive wheels for my Kayak. They work great for short trips. I use them to get the boat from my car to the water.
customer_reviews.author: Brennan Giuffre

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wheels are very large and it's a bit awkward but it works.
customer_reviews.author: amy k.

customer_reviews.title: Cart it away
customer_reviews.text: Item was a lot bigger than expected. It is meant to stow away in the kayak but doesn't fit through the cargo hatch.
customer_reviews.author: James Bryson

customer_reviews.title: Worked well on tough terrain.
customer_reviews.text: We have a lot of rocks, sand and seaweed to cross to get our kayak into the water. It handled that very well. The only problem occurred with the snap on the strap. If you pulled it really snug it would pop open. Also, when the kick stand is open, the part that you set the boat on is at an angle rather than flat. Not a big problem, just a little annoying. Over all I'm very happy with the product, but I will buy a different strap.
customer_reviews.author: pam logue

customer_reviews.title: Almost great.
customer_reviews.text: Everything is as described but the strap does not stay in place and the kayak slides off.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisD

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great cart, helps a lot. The strap could be a little better.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Secerator

customer_reviews.title: A good cart but maybe not for a canoe
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited when I bought this cart. I had just returned from a camping trip and I was pretty worn out from carrying the canoe around. When the cart came it was very easy to assemble but it did not come with any instructions or mounting suggestions. I will need to figure out how to tie my 16 foot old town canoe onto the cart. I think it will do an okay job but I should have gone with a larger one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Roll away kayak!
customer_reviews.text: We love the kayak cart. The Kayak is heavy and the wheels are light. Makes it easy to store them in the trunk of the car. When we take the Kayak off the car we just drop it right on the wheels and off to the water we go. Much easier than trying to carry the kayak to the water. Sturdy and strong. Easy to use. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would've gotten 5 stars but it would've been better if the design included two points of tie down
customer_reviews.text: Would've gotten 5 stars but it would've been better if the design included two points of tie down; regardless nothing a little bungee cord rigging expertise doesn't fix! Other than that great product helps get the FS12T around with ease!!
customer_reviews.author: YourFathersWorstNightmare

customer_reviews.title: Upset
customer_reviews.text: This item is defective. One of The wheels don't roll correctly. I've had it for a few months. Should have lasted longer than that for the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Nickey

customer_reviews.title: Back saver!
customer_reviews.text: We use this with our REI 13.5ft tamdem kayak. The Kayak weighs about 90lbs loaded with all our goodies and this is a life and back saver. The wider tires roll ok in the sand. (need a pusher and a puller) Rolls amazing on flat hard surface.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cupps

customer_reviews.title: Needs improvement.
customer_reviews.text: Could use a better lashing system. The cheap plastic buckle broke after the third use. Also, the stand up paddle board or kayak,slip out of the strap. The frame and wheels are of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: glenn

customer_reviews.title: like oily rubber
customer_reviews.text: For the money. Can’t beat it. The tires do smell a bit strong, like oily rubber. The strap is useless but I never use it anyway, the weight of my loaded 16 foot Old Towne camper keep it on there. I mainly move it over flat, gravel parking lots.
customer_reviews.author: Myke da grate

customer_reviews.title: TMS Canoe Cart
customer_reviews.text: I doubt if you can find another cart this nice at this price. Well designed and made from decent quality parts. Tires are large enough to handle most rocks and other obstacles you might encounter on a typical portage. You will want to experiment a little to determine the best place to position the cart and how to attach it on your canoe or kayak. Finally, follow the advice you see in many reviews and leave the cart outside after opening it up. The tires smell horrible!
customer_reviews.author: fotopelli

customer_reviews.title: very good to carry my windsurfing equipment to the beach
customer_reviews.text: Yes, very good to carry my windsurfing equipment to the beach, and yes, the tires stink! Aired it out for about a month now, still smells a little. Maybe a little wash will help. Other than that, great product for the price and seller sent item quickly!
customer_reviews.author: mdesu

customer_reviews.title: This makes easy work of getting my 15' Grumman canoe from the ...
customer_reviews.text: This makes easy work of getting my 15' Grumman canoe from the car to the water. It folds nicely and I can just drop it in the canoe with me so it's ready when I get out of the water. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: S.W.

customer_reviews.title: What a life saver. I have a couple Kayaks ...
customer_reviews.text: What a life saver. I have a couple Kayaks and live about a five minute walk from the lake. This just makes life so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Pan

customer_reviews.title: Good Golly My Dolly
customer_reviews.text: Fast Shipping! Slim and compact! Holds up to the weight of the boat. Easy to use. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Brad S.

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my Hobie.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my Hobie Kayak. Wells are solid so you don't have to worry about deflation.
customer_reviews.author: WER

customer_reviews.title: Great for anyone who has a kayack
customer_reviews.text: Great for anyone who has a kayack... just use a ratchet strap and toss that pos that came with it.
customer_reviews.author: King Bondo

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Replaced the strap with a bungee cord which holds much better.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Mayes

product_meta.title: TMS CART-CANOE/KAYAK-KY001((B)) Deluxe Boat Kayak Canoe Carrier Dolly Trailer Tote Trolley Transport Cart Wheel
product_meta.description: Transport a single canoe or kayak from the parking lot to the lake easily and hassle free with our Canoe and Kayak Dolly. It is designed to hold a canoe/kayak by the hull in a V-shaped cradle with 3-1/2 "L foam bumpers on each arm. Cradle arms are connected together with a 13" nylon strap to prevent the cradle from opening too far.
feature_bullets: Capacity : 120 LBS 12 Ft long tie-down strap, easy to install. Solid Metal frame; foam bumpers on each arm to protect your Canoe / Kayak hull. Sturdy double-leg kickstand allows easy loading.
Large(9-1/2"D) tires (3-1/2" wide) roll smoothly across sand and gravel. Stainless steel fasteners and chrome lynch pin. Quick assembly, only wheels need to be attached.
Material : Aluminium pipe (20 x2mm) anodized Stainless steel. Works great as a kayak dolly or canoe dolly. Dolly breaks down for easy and convenient storage or transport.

Part of the support stand features a 9-1/4"H spring-loaded stand which keeps the dolly cart propped up onshore for quick loading out of water. Large 9-1/2" diameter tires provide stable support on uneven terrain which is especially useful in sandy areas. Easily rest a kayak or canoe on the dolly cart platform, strap it down and it's ready to go. It is foldable, easy for storage.

Transport a single canoe or kayak from the parking lot to the lake easily and hassle free with our Canoe and Kayak Dolly. It is designed to hold a canoe/kayak by the hull in a V-shaped cradle with 3-1/2 "L foam bumpers on each arm. Cradle arms are connected together with a 13" nylon strap to prevent the cradle from opening too far.
